text: The theme of getting killed by a knight with a chicken head
author: Dave Bobenchik

text: Whenever I hear this song begin, my mind still expects to hear the undoing of the Binding Force a few seconds later.
author: Zack C

text: Have to say that this is one of 5 Zelda games I find to be bad and the only 2D Zelda game I think is bad. But the music is great and I love the Mele version especially.
author: xOmniCloudx

text: I'm not too familier with this soundtrack but what I'm hearing is pretty awesome I must admit.
author: VGMusicMachine

text: The difficulty can be off-putting, but this game is still pretty fun to this day. I think this game has held up better than the original, which might have been a bit TOO ambitious for its time. Zelda 2 took more tried-and-true gameplay elements which were more practical at the time.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: I don't think either it or the original game hold up at all. Both have so many flawed design decisions that would never be repeated by designers today, because they learned from games like this one.
author: drunyon214

text: drunyon214 If I had to pick one, I would choose II.
author: Skeeter Mania

text: Oh, I hadn't realised that the Great Palace's theme was slightly different to the normal one, good to know.
author: L McD

text: +L McD I've always remembered them and had to think a minute which was which, oftentimes
author: Junk Genes

text:
Huh, I'm surprised this isn't on your list already.

So having never played or grown up with this game, my first exposure to this song was Super Smash Bros. Brawl. Now, Melee was how I first learned about the awesome Palace theme, but I also enjoyed the Brawl remix of the Palace and Great Palace themes. :)
author: myohel0

text: I'll forever remember this game as the one where you chop down trees with a hammer. Couldn't they work an axe into the story?
author: Jay DiNItto

text: +Jay DiNitto True, but wasn't getting that hammer bad enough?
author: Michael Cockrum

text: +Michael Cockrum Heavens, yes. I remember calling the Nintendo hotline because I was at my wits' end with that.
author: Jay DiNItto

text: The SSBM remix of this is one of my favorite songs. Absolutely love the Great Palace theme, in just about any variation.
author: TheSeer

text: I've got such fond memories about this game. My Dad got into it and we would sit down and play it and try to figure out stuff on our own. I would play and he would take notes or even draw crude maps so we could beat a dungeon and progress. On top of that, the music is very memorable!
author: daneofurexistence

text: I love when you post NES themes <3 you should do it more often
author: Ziude

text: This game had a pretty cool soundtrack.
author: Yoshifreak2000

text: The final dungeon's theme which automatically reminds me of Thunderbird, thinking it was the final boss until you have to face Link's own shadow (Dark Link). I'd definitely be up for a clean remake of this game, but I can't see it happening.
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky I love the way they incorporated this into the Smash Temple remix for Brawl, but tbh I like the Melee one a lot more.
author: Hawlo

text: Surprise! Surprise! Heavy use of magic can accumulate in the Great Temple. Thunderbird isn't helpful when it comes to magic conservation.
author: Brian Jones
